body:
## Full code/command that generated the error
After a fresh install based upon the installation docs...
Just running through the basic Jupyter First Steps Notebook the code fails in the fig.show() command.

My notebook where you can see the error message is at https://github.com/NOAA-PMEL/EcoFOCI_Jupyter_Notebooks/blob/master/2018/Mapping%20Examples/Python-GMT%20Failed.ipynb

## Full error message
`psconvert [ERROR]: System call [gs -q -dSAFER -dNOPAUSE -dBATCH -sDEVICE=bbox -dMaxBitmap=2147483647 -dUseFastColor=true '/Volumes/WDC_internal/Users/bell/.gmt/sessions/gmt6.32329/gmt_1.ps-' 2> './psconvert_32329c.bb'] returned error 256.
`

in ipython after running the gmt.test() package gives the following failure:   

```
==================================================================================== FAILURES =====================================================================================
______________________________________________________________________________ test_load_libgmt_fail ______________________________________________________________________________

    def test_load_libgmt_fail():
        "Test that loading fails when given a bad library path."
        env = {"GMT_LIBRARY_PATH": "not/a/real/path"}
        with pytest.raises(GMTCLibNotFoundError):
>           load_libgmt(env=env)
E           Failed: DID NOT RAISE <class 'gmt.exceptions.GMTCLibNotFoundError'>

anaconda2/envs/gmt-python/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gmt/tests/test_clib.py:84: Failed
====================================================================== 1 failed, 138 passed in 56.73 seconds ======================================================================
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AssertionError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-2-84e7c468e870> in <module>()
----> 1 gmt.test()

~/anaconda2/envs/gmt-python/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gmt/__init__.py in test(doctest, verbose, coverage, figures)
    103     args.append("gmt")
    104     status = pytest.main(args)
--> 105     assert status == 0, "Some tests have failed."
```


## System information

* Operating system: OSX 10.13.15
* Python installation (Anaconda, system, ETS): Anaconda
* Version of GMT/Python: GMT=6.0.0a16 / python=3.6.5
* How you installed GMT/Python: conda and pip for gmt-python

@shaunwbell thanks for the info. I'll try to reproduce it here. I can't see anything obviously wrong but I might be missing something.

Just an update as I keep coming back to this. I've tried fresh installs of environments via conda, copying over environment files from my macbook pro laptop which does have gmt-python loaded successfully, and making sure library paths are properly being pointed too.  I still have the same jupyter error but as of today, I no longer get any failed tests.

OK, that narrows the problem down a bit, thanks! I wasn't able to reproduce the error on my machine or the CI systems. From the notebook traceback, it seems that the error is coming from ghostscript (which is what GMT uses to convert their postscript output to png).

Could you please try running:

```
conda update -c conda-forge ghostscript
```

This will try to update the ghostscript package.

`# All requested packages already installed.`

I removed by copy of ghostscript installed under homebrew as well to make sure there were no underlying conflicts... no change.
OK, this seems to be a problem with GMT messing up the postscript building. Could you try to remove all folders in the `~/.gmt/sessions` folder. This will clear away any junk that got left behind.

Removed that folder, went to reinstall from scratch and received the same error as #218 

```
GMTCLibNotFoundError: Error loading the GMT shared library '/Volumes/WDC_internal/Users/bell/anaconda2/envs/gmt-python_v2/lib/libgmt.dylib':
dlopen(/Volumes/WDC_internal/Users/bell/anaconda2/envs/gmt-python_v2/lib/libgmt.dylib, 6): Library not loaded: @rpath/libpoppler.71.dylib
  Referenced from: /Volumes/WDC_internal/Users/bell/anaconda2/envs/gmt-python_v2/lib/libgdal.20.dylib
  Reason: image not found
```

current libpoppler versions are .78 in my install

I'm realizing now it may have been a more useful attempt for me to have removed that directory and then tried the software before creating a new install/environment :grimacing:

Alas... I did try this previously (well, removing the entire ~/.gmt directory) with little help then, but that doesn't really say much for the current challenge

@shaunwbell don't worry about :) This has been a nightmare for the past week. Some of our dependencies broken on conda-forge because they are transitioning to a new compiler system. So the latest GMT6 build is incompatible with them but we need it to run GMT/Python. I'm trying to get this fixed as soon as possible.
@shaunwbell please see #221 for some updates on this. I'll close this for now and hope that #221 fixes the problems. If not, we can re-open this.

title: gmt.exceptions.GMTCLibNotFoundError
